Ben  Heckscher N/A MuckRock News, DEPT MR191090, 263 Huntington Ave Boston, MA  02115 
Dear Mr. Heckscher: 
This letter acknowledges the receipt of your FOIA request dated 08-12-25 requesting To Whom It May Concern:Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:The minutes for any meeting of the Amtrak Board of Directors that occurred in the month of October 2024, including the minutes for meetings on October 22, 2024 and October 25, 2024 that were approved at the board meeting on January 29, 2025.The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.Sincerely,Ben HeckscherUpload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Famtrak-479%252Famtrak-board-of-directors-meeting-minutes-oct-2024-191090%252F%253Femail%253DFOIAPublicLiaison%252540amtrak.com&url_auth_token=AAATVczgYa5hDtGppW4msQn1q3M%3A1ulll9%3AFGL6AYUmYtuKkrOEbDXLkUg2OOBP7okrj7bWpo_EHBA. 
This request has been issued tracking number 25-FOI-00526.  Please reference this number in all correspondence and communications with this office. 

Portions have been withheld under FOIA Exemption 5. 

FOIA Exemption 5 (deliberative process privilege) applies to inter-agency orintra-agency records where, for instance, there is a work product that is indraft format or documents that contain deliberations between parties leading upto a decision. 
Pursuantto Amtrak’s FOIA regulations (49 CFR 701.10), if you do not agree with Amtrak’sdecision, you may file an appeal with William Herrmann, Executive VicePresident, Chief Legal and Human Resources Officer, within ninety days (90) ofthe date of this letter, specifying the relevant facts and the basis for yourappeal.  Your appeal may be mailed to Mr.Herrmann’s attention:  National RailroadPassenger Corporation, Law Department, One Massachusetts Avenue, NW,Washington, DC  20001.  The President and CEO of Amtrak has delegatedauthority to the General Counsel and Corporate Secretary for the rules andcompliance to the FOIA. 
If you have any questions regarding the processing of your request, please feel free to contact me at Rebecca.Conner@amtrak.com or at 202-906-3215.  For further assistance and to discuss any aspect of your request you may also contact our FOIA Public Liaison at FoiaPublicLiaison@amtrak.com.  Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS), National Archives and Records Administration, Room 2510, 8601 Adelphi Road, College Park, MD  20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov, telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or fax 202-741-5769. 
Thank you, FOIA Officer

Ben Heckscher

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: SOR and Community Supervision
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

The exact number of people who are 

1) on both the sex offender registry and probation; and
2) on both the sex offender registry and parole;

as per the latest available data is requested.

If this cannot be provided, I request records that include:

The list of people on probation
The list of people on parole
The list of people on the sex offender registry

as per the latest available data. 

If this data is held by another agency, I request the name of that agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wendy Sawyer

I wanted to follow up on the following Illinois Freedom of Information Act. request, copied below, and originally submitted on July 17, 2025. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Re: FOIA # 06306722 Extension
communications.communication:
August 5, 2025


Re: FOIA # 06306722 Extension

The Illinois State Police (ISP) acknowledges receipt of your attached Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request. A response to your request is due August 5, 2025. However, additional time is needed to respond to your request. In accordance with Section 3(e) of FOIA (5 ILCS 140/3(e)), ISP is extending the response due date for an additional five business days for the following reasons:

The requested records are stored in whole or in part at another location.

The request requires the collection of a substantial number of records.

The request is stated in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records requested.

X  The requested records have not yet been located and additional time is needed to complete the search.

X  The requested records require examination and evaluation to determine if the documents are exempt from disclosure and/or must be redacted.

X  The requested records cannot be provided within the prescribed time frame without causing an undue burden or interfering with the operation of ISP.

Consultation is needed with another public body in order to respond to the request.

ISP handles requests for video records separately. Depending on the records you requested, you may receive additional correspondence for either video or paper and audio records.

Sincerely,

Sarah Wheeler
Illinois State Police
Freedom of Information Officer
801 South 7th Street, Suite 1000-S
Springfield, Illinois 62703
ISP.FOIA.Officer@Illinois.gov

files.title: 06306722 Request (7-29-25)_JS
files.source: Illinois State Police, Illinois

communications.subject: ISP FOIA Request No. 06306722 - Response
communications.communication:
August 12, 2025

RE: FOIA Request # 06306722  Response

Thank you for writing the Illinois State Police (ISP) with your request for information pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1, et seq. ISP acknowledges receipt of your FOIA request received on July 29, 2025.

ISP is unable to comply with the portion of your request seeking the number of individuals who are on the Sex Offender Registry (SOR) and probation or parole. A list of individuals on the Illinois SOR can be located at https://isp.illinois.gov/Sor/Disclaimer. A manual search of each individual on the SOR would be required to determine how many are on parole. Not only would this be unduly burdensome, but the information would have to be searched within the LEADS database which is exempt pursuant to Section 7(1)(a) of FOIA and 20 Ill. Adm. Code 1240.80(d). Further, ISP does not house records of individuals on probation.

You have the right to review by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) in the Office of the Attorney General (5 ILCS 140/9.5(a)). You may reach the PAC at:

500 S. 2nd Street
Springfield, Illinois 62701
(877) 299-3642
public.access@ilag.gov

You also have the right to judicial review under 5 ILCS 140/11.

Sincerely,

Sarah Wheeler
Illinois State Police
Freedom of Information Officer
801 South 7th Street, Suite 1000-S
Springfield, Illinois 62703
ISP.FOIA.Officer@Illinois.gov

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police disciplinary files (Pend Oreille County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Moe Clark

title: Police Foundations PR (California Highway Patrol)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Police Foundations PR (California Highway Patrol)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am seeking records as they relate to the department and donations, grants, or other gifts from police nonprofits, including Foundations, Benevolent Funds, Boosters, Activities Leagues, and Associations. Include local and national police nonprofits.

Documents, physical or digital copies of: 
Memorandum of Understanding or any formal agreements with nonprofits.
Polices related to accepting and soliciting donations, monetary and nonmonetary, and grants from any nonprofit.
Policies or requirements by the department on how donations are to be tracked.
Policies regarding any conflict of interest requirements.
Formal grant requests or donation requests filled out by the department or a representative for the department.

Databases that include spreadsheets or whatever form the department tracks such information: 
Donor name
What was donated, monetary and non-monetary value
Date
Release data in .csv form 

For grant and donation data, please only include items and cash valued $500 or more.
Limit searches to 2020 to 2025

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Hawaii Department Of Corrections)

communications.subject: Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Hawaii Department Of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Hawaii Department Of Corrections)
communications.communication:
Mr. Ma,

This is to confirm that our office received your request and informing you that we are currently working on obtaining records pertaining to your request and will need additional time. This request will need to be handled through the following process.

Pursuant to HRS §92F, and the Office of information Practices Administrative Rules, §2-71-19, when a person requests access to a government record under Part II of Chapter 92F, HRS, the agency may charge the requester:

(a) (1) Fees for searching, reviewing, and segregating the record; provided that these fees shall be assessed in accordance with this chapter; and
(b) An agency may require a requester to prepay the following before an agency begins the search for and review of records in order to respond to a request for access:

(1) Fifty percent of the total estimated fees for searching, for reviewing, and segregating records when the estimated fees exceed $30;
(2) One hundred percent of the estimated fees from previous requests, including abandoned requests, in accordance with subsection (d).

Accordingly, in any request for information to DCR, the following charges apply for responsive documents: 1) @2.50 for each 15-minute period of search time; 2) $5.00 for each 15-minute period of review time and segregation; and 3) $0.50 per page for documents copied/digitized. The information that you seek is not readily available and will require a manual search, review, and segregation time. The estimated cost cannot be calculated at this time as I need a response from the section where we would obtain this information from. I will keep you updated as soon as I can, you will be notified of the final balance with payment due prior to releasing the information should there be any.

Thank you,
Cheyenne Evans
Department of Corrections & Rehabilitation
Litigation Coordination Office
Acting Departmental Program Officer / PREA Coordinator
Certified DOJ PREA Auditor
1177 Alakea St.
Honolulu, HI 96813

communications.subject: RE: Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Hawaii Department Of Corrections)
communications.communication:
Hi Cheyenne,

Thank you for your detailed response and for beginning to process my request. I appreciate you outlining the applicable procedures and fee structure.

I understand that the information may require manual search and review, and I'll wait for your update once the relevant section has responded and an estimate is available.

Thanks again for your help, and I look forward to hearing from you.

Warm regards,
Andrew Ma

title: Sandy Build It Back Data

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Sandy Build It Back Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I hearby request copy of a spreadsheet detailing money spent through Build It Back and the Mayor's Office of Housing Recovery following Hurricane Sandy, by lot or by address,  including homeowners that received funding to be have their buildings elevated and homes that were purchased outright by the city.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gwynne Hogan

title: Aggregated Statewide Property Parcel Data

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Aggregated Statewide Property Parcel Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act (KRS 61.870 et seq.), I hereby request the following records:

I request electronic copies of all aggregated statewide property parcel data maintained by the Department of Revenue, including but not limited to: parcel numbers, account numbers, location addresses, subdivisions, descriptions, classes, tax districts, deed info, acres, owner information, valuations (with history, exemptions, and taxable assessments), improvement details, land details (e.g., plat books, lot sizes, zoning, flood planes), sales history, recent comparables, photos, historical property cards, and any associated GIS data or shapefiles. Please provide in a machine-readable format such as CSV, Excel, or database export.

If certain data is not available at the state level, please specify exactly what is missing and direct me to the appropriate county sources. This request is for a commercial project. Please provide a fee estimate before processing.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment or secure download link if available.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ethan Moore

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: E & A Occupancy + Fire Sprinkler Information (City Of Schertz)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request an electronic, parcel-level extract containing current Group E (Educational) and Group A (Assembly) occupancies and associated fire-sprinkler information for all parcels within the jurisdiction: 

Please provide one CSV with the following columns (your native field names are fine):
- Parcel identifier (APN / PIN / BBL)
• Site address (street #, street, city, ZIP)
• Latitude & longitude
• Internal building / permit ID
• Year built
• Floor area (sq ft)
• Number of stories
• Current IBC occupancy code (E, A-1…A-5)
• Occupancy description
• Fire-sprinkler present (Yes / No / Unknown)
• Date of last fire-sprinkler inspection (if tracked)
• Owner name & mailing address (if stored)

If any field is not maintained, please note that rather than withholding the entire record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Cavise

title: Edmund Michael Gutierrez interaction reports

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Edmund Michael Gutierrez interaction reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Regarding an interaction with Edmund Michael Gutierrez on 07/05/2010:
- All incident, dispatch log entries and arrest reports. Incident reports and case records refer to reports produced with notes and narratives, a description of what happened by the responding officer, trace reports, case notes and litigation files
- All unedited body-worn camera / bodycam recordings. I am specifically requesting the unedited body-worn camera recordings captured by all officers present for the full duration of the incident, including audio recordings associated with the footage. If any portion of the requested footage must be redacted, I ask that you clearly indicate the portions that have been redacted and provide an explanation of the legal basis for the redactions
- All 911 or calls for service logs, audio and transcripts
- All computer aided dispatch (CAD) reports and a copy of your department’s dispatch 10 signals/codes, agency dispatch signals/codes and CAD signals/codes

I request these records in their native digital formats and not in formats that degrade the accessibility of the records, such as tabular data converted to PDF or Word files. If converting the native digital format to another high-fidelity format, such as CSV or Excel, please take care not to introduce formatting inconsistencies or errors, which can occur in the conversion process (for example, encoding errors or the inclusion of internal unescaped quotation marks in CSV files). Should the records above represent certain values as numeric codes or abbreviations that are not self-explanatory, I additionally request all records necessary to interpret those codes and abbreviations.

I am a member of the news media. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Production of Responsive Records on a Rolling Basis: In the event that a portion of the present request is completed before the full request is completed, I ask that the records be produced on a rolling basis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Hopkins

communications.subject: JMD FOIA Request 137393 Acknowledgement (Intranet Quorum IMA00175683)
communications.communication:
May 21, 2025  Ms. Lola Leetz  DEPT MR 182298 
MuckRock News 
263 Huntington Ave 
Boston, MA 02115-4506  Re: The amount of bitcoin held by the U.S. Marshals Service  Assigned JMD FOIA TRACKING NUMBER: 137393  Dear Ms. Leetz:  This is to acknowledge receipt of your Freedom of Information Act request dated 3/2/2025 and received in this office on 5/21/2025 in which you requested records concerning the subject identified above.  Your request was sent to JMD by the US Marshals Service as a misdirected request. The identifying tracking number was 2025-USMS-001026.  For your information, the Justice Management Division assigns incoming requests to one of three tracks: simple, complex, or expedited. Each request is then handled on a first-in, first-out basis in relation to other requests in the same track. Simple requests usually receive a response in approximately one month whereas complex requests necessarily take longer. At this time, your request has been assigned to the Complex track. Please note that as a general matter, records in the Department are decentralized and our response will only cover information originating with or relating to JMD. If you are seeking information originating with or relating to other components of the Department, please make a FOIA request directly to those components.  If you have a question about the status of your FOIA request, you may contact this office by emailing JMDFOIA@usdoj.gov or by calling 202-616-0253 during regular business hours (Monday through Friday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., Eastern Time, excluding federal holidays).  Please refer to your assigned JMD FOIA TRACKING NUMBER listed above whenever you contact the Department regarding this request.  Sincerely,  Daniel Wagner FOIA Contact Justice Management Division

title: Termination of Jamie John mural at Gichigamiin Indigenous Nations Museum

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Termination of Jamie John mural at Gichigamiin Indigenous Nations Museum
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any COMMUNICATIONS (defined below) to or from any of the OFFICIALS (defined below) between August 5, 2025 and August 11, 2025 (inclusive of each date), which either: (a) pertains to the mural planned by, started by, proposed by, or involving Jamie John at the Gichigamiin Indigenous Nations Museum; or (b) mentions any of the TERMS (defined below).

"OFFICIALS" means and includes Mayor Daniel Bliss, City manager Luke Stowe, Deputy City Manager Carina E. Sánchez, and Assistant to the City Manager Tasheik Kerr.

"COMMUNICATIONS" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: List of FOIA requests

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: List of FOIA requests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list or systematic record or list of FOIA requests submitted to the Detroit Land Bank Authority. Many public agencies in Michigan keep such "FOIA logs" to facilitate their compliance with the state's FOIA, which requires, among other things, that requests be retained for at least one year after they are received (MCL 15.233.3(2)). Such documents often exist electronically as a simple list or in another form of structured data that includes, for instance, the date of each request and the record requested.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Mondry

title: NPDES Permits Puerto Rico

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NPDES Permits Puerto Rico
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

According to documents released to me through a previous FOIA request, the NPDES permit for the Palo Seco Power Plant in Puerto Rico was "administratively extended" past its March 31, 2021 expiration date. The renewal application date for the permit was September 30, 2020. The current NPDES permit is not accessible through the NPDES database for Puerto Rico administered by EPA Region 2.  

Meanwhile, in the EPA database for NPDES permits for Puerto Rico, there are multiple NPDES permits that have seemingly gone past their expiration date without being renewed. The database can be found here:  https://www.epa.gov/npdes-permits/puerto-rico-npdes-permits

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Every current NPDES permit for Puerto Rico. To aid in your search, a list of facilities can be found here: https://www.epa.gov/npdes-permits/puerto-rico-npdes-permits

2) Any document certifying which NPDES permits for Puerto Rico have been "administratively extended."

Keywords: "administratively extended," "Puerto Rico," and "NPDES"

This request is for all records produced between January 1, 2015 and the date this request is processed. Please send records to me on a rolling basis. Please omit any duplicate records.

The requested documents will be used in the course of reporting about environmental issues in Puerto Rico for the newsletter Heavy Weather: heavyweather.ghost.io. Documents retrieved from this request will be made available to the general public and the request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

"To Whom It May Concern:Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:According to documents released to me through a previous FOIA request, the NPDES permit for the Palo Seco Power Plant in Puerto Rico was "administratively extended" past its March 31, 2021 expiration date. The renewal application date for the permit was September 30, 2020. The current NPDES permit is not accessible through the NPDES database for Puerto Rico administered by EPA Region 2.Meanwhile, in the EPA database for NPDES permits for Puerto Rico, there are multiple NPDES permits that have seemingly gone past their expiration date without being renewed. The database can be found here: https://www.epa.gov/npdes-permits/puerto-rico-npdes-permitsTherefore, I request the following records:1) Every current NPDES permit for Puerto Rico. To aid in your search, a list of facilities can be found here: https://www.epa.gov/npdes-permits/puerto-rico-npdes-permits2) Any document certifying which NPDES permits for Puerto Rico have been "administratively extended."Keywords: "administratively extended," "Puerto Rico," and "NPDES"This request is for all records produced between January 1, 2015 and the date this request is processed. Please send records to me on a rolling basis. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not." Given the scope of the request, EPA anticipates that the response will require significant amount of EPA’s resources and time to search for and collect the requested records from EPA offices that are separate from the office processing the request. Pursuant to 40 C.F.R. § 2.104(d), and extension of time required to respond to your request is necessary.  The new due date is 01/28/2025, ten working days from 01/13/2025.  For an update on the status of your FOIA request, please contact me or access FOIAXpress. If you would like to modify or narrow your request so that it may be processed sooner.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2025-EPA-01870
communications.communication:
Hi Wanda,

Hope your day is going well!

Like we talked about during the call, please limit the request to NPDES permits for energy-related projects, while also including PREPA and EcoElectrica installations. Please also include any letters or enforcement actions that reference the aforementioned energy-related projects and their NPDES permits being administratively extended. Also, include any correspondence with the Department of Natural and Environmental Resources (DNER, in English) relating to the NPDES permits for energy-related projects.

I think that sums up everything we talked about yesterday. Let me know if you have any doubts or concerns.

Thank you!

Best wishes,
Carlos

communications.subject: More response time needed to complete FOIA 2025 EPA 01870
communications.communication:
Saludos Carlos, 

Espero que te encuentres en perfecta salud y los tuyos por igual!!  That's important!  This communication is about the subject FOIA request; the recently revised submittal.  This to say, EPA is going to need more response time to complete your inquiry.  Unfortunately, these types of coordination efforts take time so that we can apply due diligence and care.  Plus, we have multiple components/individuals involved in the response process as you know. 

Conversely, the EPA Team of experts is working on your request.  In fact, I just arrived at an email regarding a records collection repository that's been set up for your FOIA (I've been out for a while).  This is my progress/status report for you.  This to say, EPA will need until 04/30/2025 to complete your FOIA.  The Agency will endeavor to complete the response prior to this target date.  Please call me if you have any questions, but I'm also required to notify you that if you need any further assistance or would like to discussany aspect of your request, you may seek assistance from EPA’s FOIA PublicLiaison at hq.foia@epa.gov or call (202)566-1667. You may also seek assistance from the Office of GovernmentInformation Services (OGIS). You may contact OGIS in any of the following ways:by mail, Office of Government Information Services, National Archives andRecords Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road, College Park, MD 20740-6001; email: (mailto:hq.foia@epa.gov) ogis@nara.gov; telephone: (202) 741-5770 or(877) 684-6448; or fax: (202) 741-5769. For all media inquiries, please contact (mailto:ogis@nara.gov) press@epa.gov. (mailto:press@epa.gov) 
Gracias, Carlos! 

Sincerely, 

Wanda Calderon 
Government Information Specialist 
Office of Regional Counsel 
EPA Region 2 Lead FOIA Program 
212-637-3668 
www.epa.gov/foia (http://www.epa.gov/foia%C2%A0)

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2025-EPA-01870
communications.communication:

Gracias por preguntar. Estoy bien. ¡Espero que su familia y usted estén saludable y bien! Thanks for the update on the request and for sending me the estimated completion date. Really appreciated it.

Best wishes,
Carlos

Carlos Polanco
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 177419
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

RE:        EPA Freedom of Information Act Request -  2025-EPA-01870, Final Response Letter

Hello Carlos Polanco,

Dear Carlos Polanco,

I'm following up regarding the attached correspondence, which was mailed to EPA Region 2 but references NFO Ryan Dominguez. Please note that your FOIA request (#2025-EPA-01870) was officially closed out on March 11, 2025, by my former colleague Wanda Calderon from Region 2. communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Academic Dishonesty Study (University Of Wisconsin- Stout)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like a spreadsheet containing all the academic dishonesty reports from the beginning of the Fall 2021 semester to the end of the Spring 2025 Semester, organized by university college.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Anonymous

files.source: University Of Wisconsin- Stout, Menomonie, WI

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] - RE: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Academic Dishonesty Study (University Of Wisconsin- Stout)
communications.communication:
Good Morning-

As we work on your request, we would like to further understand what fields of information you are requesting to better support our ability to follow through on your request in a timely manner. A “a spreadsheet containing all the academic dishonesty reports” is not something maintained as a standing document but instead would be a function of a download of information from our conduct database.

Please also note that which college would not be an ordinal piece of data available as academic dishonest reports are tracked centrally and may only appear nominally depending on the field. If you are requesting narrative reports, please note this will impact our response timeline as they will require significant care for redaction purposes to protect student identities.

Your request will likely be subject to Wis. Stat. § 19.36(1) and the Family Education Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA).  The FERPA statute and regulations (20 U.S.C. § 1232g, 34 C.F.R. Part 99) prohibit educational institutions from releasing non-directory, personally identifiable student information from education records absent prior written authorization from the student.  20 U.S.C. § 1232g(b)(2)(A), 34 C.F.R. § 99.30.  “Personally identifiable information” includes any “information that, alone or in combination, is linked or linkable to a specific student that would allow a reasonable person in the school community, who does not have personal knowledge of the relevant circumstances, to identify the student with reasonable certainty.” 34 C.F.R. § 99.3.

We look forward to your response.
Best,

Ian

communications.subject: RE: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Academic Dishonesty Study (University Of Wisconsin- Stout)
communications.communication:
To whom it may concern,

Thank you for responding to our request. I should have been more specific in the initial request. In the request, the total number of academic dishonesty reports for each of the following years:
2021-22
2022-23
2023-24
2024-25

We do not need any student names, faculty names, department names, or college names, only the total number of dishonesty reports for each year. With that qualifier, I believe this would no longer fall under FERPA protection, since no record is tied to an individual and all records are aggregated to the college level. Thank you in advance for your cooperation.



David May, Ph.D.
Mississippi State University

title: Carter Camp FBI FOIA (Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Carter Camp FBI FOIA (Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents and files, including letters, memos, emails and all communications pertaining to former American Indian Movement leader Carter Camp (born August 18, 1941 - died December 27, 2013). An obituary of whom was published in the New York Times on January 8, 2014. A copy of his obituary is attached to this request as a PDF, and it may also be found at https://www.nytimes.com/2014/01/09/us/carter-camp-american-indian-leader-dies-at-72.html

I would also like to request a search of all available cross-index files for mentions of Carter Camp in other documents, to be included with this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Estes

communications.subject: Acknowledgment Letter 2024-01599
communications.communication:
August 5, 2024                                              REFER TO:  2024-01599 

Mr. Nicholas Estes 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR167963 
Boston, Massachusetts  02115 

Dear Mr. Estes: 

This is to acknowledge receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated July 7, 2024, and received by the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) on July 8, 2024, in which you requested all documents pertaining to former American Indian Movement Leader Carter Camp.  Your request was assigned ATF tracking number 2024-01599.  Please refer to this number in any future communications regarding this request. 

The records you seek require a search in at least one other office within ATF.  Accordingly, your request presents “unusual circumstances” under the FOIA.  See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B)(iii)(I).  Because of these unusual circumstances, we are extending the time limit to respond to your request by ten additional days, as permitted by the statute.  We have not completed a search to determine whether there are records within the scope of your request.  The time needed to process your request will depend on the complexity of our records search and on the volume and complexity of any records located. 

For your information, this office assigns incoming requests to one of three tracks: simple, complex, or expedited.  Each request is then handled on a first-in, first-out basis in relation to other requests in the same track.  Simple requests usually receive a response in approximately one month, whereas complex requests necessarily take longer.  Your request was assigned to the Complex track.  It was placed in chronological order based on the date of receipt and will be handled as quickly as possible when it is assigned for processing. 

Because this Office is not assessing any fees in connection with the processing of FOIA requests at this time, there is no need for us to determine whether your request qualifies for a waiver of fees. 

If you have any questions regarding the status of your request, you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison at 202-648-7390.   Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001; e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769. 

Sincerely, 

Hirsh D. Kravitz 
Acting Chief 
Information and Privacy Governance Division

communications.subject: Update on Your FOIA Request with ATF
communications.communication:
Hello  Nicholas Estes,

Thank you for your continued patience as we process your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request. We are writing to inform you that your request is still open and actively being worked on. We are tracking your request using the original request ID: 2024-01599.

Please note that the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) is currently undergoing a system migration. Starting Sunday, September 22, 2024, we will temporarily lose access to our current system. However, there is no need for concern; our team will continue processing your request during this transition.

You will receive updates about our new system via email from foia-team@atf.gov. If you have any questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to us at the same email address.

Should your request still be open when the new system is implemented, you will receive a new link to create an account in the updated system, where documents will be shared. If your request is complete, we will notify you through email. Alternatively, if you no longer wish for our office to continue processing your request, please let us know that as well.

For any immediate inquiries, please contact our FOIA Public Liaisons at 202-648-7390.

Thank you for your understanding and support during this transition.

Sincerely,

Hirsh D. Kravitz
Acting Chief
Information and Privacy Governance Division
Bureau of Alcohol Tobacco Firearms and Explosives (ATF)

communications.subject: Important Update: ATF FOIA Requests System Migration
communications.communication:
We are writing to inform you of an important update regarding your FOIA request 2024-01599. The Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives (ATF) has successfully migrated to a new system, FOIAXpress, and introduced the FOIA Public Access Link (PAL) portal. This portal allows requesters to track their requests, submit new ones, and receive responsive documents securely. 
Please create an account at using the same email address you used to submit your request. Once your account is created, please https://foia-pal.atf.gov (https://foia-pal.atf.gov) notify us via the PAL messaging feature. 
Moving forward: 
 
  *  All FOIA request correspondence must be conducted exclusively through PAL. 
  *  All document releases will be handled via PAL. Email communications for FOIA requests will no longer be processed. 
If you encounter any technical issues or need assistance with PAL, please contact our support team at foia-pal-support@atf.gov 
Thank you for your cooperation as we transition to this improved system. We appreciate your understanding and look forward to continuing to assist you through the ATF FOIA PAL portal. Sincerely, 
ATF FOIA Team

title: Tom Hayden

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Request: Tom Hayden
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to Thomas Emmet "Tom" Hayden (December 11, 1939 – October 23, 2016) who was an American social and political activist, author and politician, who was director of the Peace and Justice Resource Center in Culver City, California. Known best for his major role as an anti-war, civil rights, and radical intellectual counterculture activist, Hayden was the former husband of actress Jane Fonda and the father of actor Troy Garity. His death has been widely reported. http://www.nytimes.com/2016/10/25/us/tom-hayden-dead.html

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the Bureau for AND Magazine, MuckRock and Glomar Disclosure. My articles have been widely read, with some reaching over 100,000 readers. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Michael Best

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request #1360231-000
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Best,


Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Our complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.



Currently, simple track cases average approximately 181 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 232 days from the date of receipt for processing, those in the large processing track are currently averaging approximately 659 days, and those in the extra-large track are averaging 998 days.

Thank you,

Holly Early
Government Information Specialist

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information request, copied below, and originally submitted on Oct. 24, 2016. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response, or if further clarification is needed.  You had assigned it reference number #1360231-000.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request #1360231-000
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Best,



Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps, and follow the instructions below.



Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request

If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-0] please enter [1195846-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-1] please enter [1195846-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov>.



FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- LAST UPDATED ON February 8, 2017



Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]



FOIPA:

Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:

FOIPA:

1234567-000

Case Type:

FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)

The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.

You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.
NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion

Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Our complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.



Currently, simple track cases average approximately 181 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 232 days from the date of receipt for processing, those in the large processing track are currently averaging approximately 659 days, and those in the extra-large track are averaging 998 days.


Thank you,


Holly Early
Government Information Specialist
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS)
FBI-Records Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
PIO Line: (540) 868-4593
Direct: (540) 868-4854
Fax: (540) 868-4391 or (450)868-4997
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps.    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

title: Stanely Sporkin (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Stanely Sporkin (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Stanley Sporkin (February 7, 1932 – March 23, 2020), who was a director of enforcement for the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), general counsel for the Central Intelligence Agency and United States federal judge of the United States District Court for the District of Columbia. This request includes, but is not limited to, any internally produced history studies which deal with Mr. Sporkin and his time as general counsel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

FOIPA

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 106 days from the date of receipt for processing. communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Armed Forces Communications and Electronics Association
communications.communication:
Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 134 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 523 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,335 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,875 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1416797-000
communications.communication:
I am appealing the Bureau's decision to process only 100 pages and not the full 1,359 pages, in direct contradiction to my instruction on 5/22/2019 (https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/armed-forces-communications-and-electronics-association-60146/#comm-727137). 

Regardless of a fee waiver being denied, the amount of pages was less than 5,000 and thus the Bureau was prohibited from charging duplication fees. The Bureau made no attempts to negotiate (all communications are recorded on https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/armed-forces-communications-and-electronics-association-60146/) and took nearly five years to respond to the request. The Bureau took a full six months to even ask for fees, at which point they were already prohibited from doing so.

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Police disciplinary files

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Everett Public Schools District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Everett Public Schools District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

In the event the District chooses to provide these records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

I request electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record. 

I request for these public records to be produced by public (no password) e-mail attachment or link. If electronic attachment or link is not possible, an alternative would be to produce responsive records via USB DRIVE or DATA CD-ROM.

THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING MADE FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PRA Audit

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Everett Public Schools District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
Dear PRA Audit,

I am the public records officer for Everett Public Schools and am writing in response to your request for records received on Friday, November 5, 2021. In that request you asked for “a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Everett Public Schools District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.” Additionally, you requested that if installments are provided, that they should be produced in reverse chronological order, from most recent to the earliest, and requested electronic production of records in their native electronic format for each record. Lastly, you requested that records be provided by email attachments or electronic link and provided instructions for mailing any records being produced on a USB drive or CD. Thank you for confirming that your request is not for commercial purposes. A copy of your complete request can be located in the email string below.

In accordance with RCW 42.56.520<https://app.leg.wa.gov/rcw/default.aspx?cite=42.56.520>, I am acknowledging receipt of your request and providing notice that the district will require additional time to respond. This time is needed to seek any clarifications to the request, to locate and assemble the information requested, to potentially notify any affected third parties, and to review the records for any exempt information.

At this time, given the 11-year timeframe of this request, and until the full scope of the request is ascertained, we estimate that it will take several years to respond in full to this request. We anticipate providing an initial installment of records on or before January 7, 2022, providing monthly installments thereafter. The district is currently processing multiple requests for records, and, like yours, the size and scope of these requests vary in nature, and some of these requests are quite extensive and take a great deal of time to process. While we do our best to respond to requests as quickly as possible, we have limited staff and resources available to process these requests. At this time of the year especially, with the upcoming holidays and the closure of district facilities for the Thanksgiving and winter breaks, staff resources are even more limited.

As students are the nature of our business, many public records frequently include information about students. If any of the responsive documents contain student names or other identifying information (parent names, student ID numbers etc.), it is the typical practice of the district to redact those names when the requestor agrees to that practice. Please let us know if you have an objection to such redaction and the basis of your objection.

In addition, as part of our typical practice, if you do not review or claim your records within 30 days of a notification that an installment of records is ready for you, by indicating receipt of the records made available to you, or by indicating that you are unable to access the records made available to you, we will consider your request to be abandoned after 30 calendar days and close it at that time without further action.

We look forward to working with you for a satisfactory resolution to your request for public records. For reference, all the district’s policies and procedures for public records are available on our website at this page: https://everettsd.org/publicrecords.org.

Regards,




Sarah Mack
General Counsel
Superintendent's Office
SMack@everettsd.org<mailto:SMack@everettsd.org>
425-385-4123
[cid:image002.png@01D7D649.21D9FD90]<http://www.everettsd.org/site/default.aspx?PageID=1>

files.source: Everett Public Schools District, Everett, WA

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Everett Public Schools District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
Dear PRA Audit,

I am the public records officer for Everett Public Schools and am writing in response to your request for records received on Friday, November 5, 2021. In that request you asked for “a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Everett Public Schools District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.” Additionally, you requested that if installments are provided, that they should be produced in reverse chronological order, from most recent to the earliest, and requested electronic production of records in their native electronic format for each record. Lastly, you requested that records be provided by email attachments or electronic link and provided instructions for mailing any records being produced on a USB drive or CD. Thank you for confirming that your request is not for commercial purposes. A copy of your complete request can be located in the email string below.

I am writing to let you know that we have an initial installment of records available for you. As requested, the records are being provided in reverse chronological order and represent 56 of the public records requests received in 2021, and the district responses to those requests. No new or additional redactions have been made to this particular installment of records, and the responsive records appear just as they did when provided to the original requester. A detailed redaction/exemption log, as it was provided to the original requester, is included with each request where applicable.

We noted that your preference was to receive the records as email attachments, however, the size of this initial installment is too large to be sent via email. Therefore, these records are being provided electronically via a shared file which you can access using the link below. As requested, this is a public link and is not password protected.

[​Folder icon] Public Records Request – MuckRock PRA Audit<https://epscloud-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/09566_apps_everettsd_org/Etb5ZK1KDiVOp5A87K-hF5ABqFZVzMWPCVx55LVIpw5WxA?e=qYDwlM>

Please reply to this email to confirm receipt of the requested records, as the system will not notify us when you have accessed your records.

As part of our typical practice, if you do not review or claim your records within 30 days of this notification that an installment of records is ready for you, either by indicating receipt of the records made available to you or by indicating that you are unable to access the records made available to you, we will consider your request to be abandoned and close it at that time without further action. Accordingly, if we do not hear from you by February 7, 2022, your request will be deemed abandoned, the link to the files will no longer be available, and we will close your request at that time without any further action.

Please note that to “claim” or “review” records that are shared via an electronic link such as the one above, you must click the link and either download the files or click on the files to open them, and you must notify us that you have accessed the files or that you are unable to access the records made available to you no later than February 7, 2022. Again, if you fail to respond to this notification by that date, your request will be deemed abandoned, the link to the files will no longer be available, and we will close your request at that time without any further action.

With regard to the remainder of your request, we anticipate the next installment of records responsive to your request will be available on or before February 11, 2022.

Regards,




Sarah Mack
General Counsel
Superintendent's Office
SMack@everettsd.org<mailto:SMack@everettsd.org>
425-385-4123

Lastly, you requested that records be provided by email attachments or electronic link and provided instructions for mailing any records being produced on a USB drive or CD. Thank you for confirming that your request is not for commercial purposes. A copy of your complete request can be located in the email string below.

I am writing to let you know that we have a second installment of records available for you. As requested, the records are being provided in reverse chronological order and represent an additional 36 of the public records requests received in 2021, and the district responses to those requests. A detailed redaction/exemption log, as it was provided to the original requester, is included with each request where applicable. New redactions are marked with a redaction code directly on the responsive records, and the explanation for those redactions can be found using the Redaction Code Log, which is provided with the installment. These redactions primarily include student names or other student/parent identifying information, or the redaction of staff personal information such as a personal email address or cell phone number. In addition, one record was withheld in its entirety as the record is a student education record and is protected from public disclosure (the original requester was the parent of the student whose education record it was). An Exemption Log for this record is also provided in this installment.

We noted that your preference was to receive the records as email attachments, however, the size of this installment is too large to be sent via email. Therefore, these records are being provided electronically via a shared file which you can access using the link below. As requested, this is a public link and is not password protected.

[​Folder icon] Public Records Request – MuckRock PRA Audit<https://epscloud-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/09566_apps_everettsd_org/ErZyFIvyVTBNqV9mmDkx-sEBSOkFAxLiwaKniCabzzGOWw?e=9lNHuO>

The system will not notify us when you access your records. Please reply to this email to confirm receipt of the requested records.

As part of our typical practice, if you do not review or claim your records within 30 days of this notification that an installment of records is ready for you, we will consider your request to be abandoned and close it at that time without further action.

Please note that to “claim” or “review” records that are shared via an electronic link such as the one above, within 30 days you must:


  1.  click the link above; and
  2.  download or click on the files; and
  3.  notify us to indicate receipt of the records made available to you or to let us know that you are unable to access the records made available to you.

We have yet received a response from you verifying receipt of our last installment provided on January 7, 2022. We are providing an additional opportunity for you to respond to our notifications that an installment of records has been made available to you.

If you fail to respond to this notification by March 14, 2022, your request will be deemed abandoned, the link to the files will no longer be available, and we will close your request at that time without any further action.

With regard to the remainder of your request, as we have not heard from you since your original request was made and we have not received confirmation of your receipt of the January 7, 2022 installment, we have halted further work on this request until we receive confirmation of receipt of both installments provided to date. Upon such confirmation, the anticipated date for the next installment of records will be provided. Otherwise, your request will be deemed abandoned without further action as noted above.

Regards,




Sarah Mack

Lastly, you requested that records be provided by email attachments or electronic link and provided instructions for mailing any records being produced on a USB drive or CD.
